name: deceq1i
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c2, c1)), wceq(c0, c2))
stmt.pretty: ax-mp(cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c2, c1), c0 = c2)

body.origin:
|- wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c2, c1))
-| wceq(c0, c2)
-| wi(wceq(c0, c2), wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c2, c1)))
body.pretty:
⊢ cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c2, c1)
⊣ c0 = c2
⊣ (c0 = c2 → cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c2, c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c2, c1))
-| wceq(c0, c2)
-| wi(wceq(c0, c2), wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c2, c1)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c2, c1)
⊣ c0 = c2
⊣ (c0 = c2 → cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c2, c1))

body.origin: |- wi(wceq(c0, c2), wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c2, c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c2, c1))
-| wceq(c0, c2)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c2, c1)
⊣ c0 = c2

comment: Equality theorem for the decimal constructor. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Apr-2015.)
